diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient presented with severe abdominal pain that began periumbilically and transitioned to the right lower quadrant (RLQ), accompanied by new fevers, chills, night sweats, and loss of appetite. A CT scan of the abdomen and pelvis indicated a dilated appendix (8 mm) with wall enhancement and fluid filled but no free fluid or free air, confirming the diagnosis of acute appendicitis.
